rComments: I felt very lucky to take my major seminar with Professor Emmett. She chose an interesting and relevant topic (basic income) and we had some great class discussions. She's young, down to earth and approachable while also very knowledgeable in social/political philosophy. She'll likely only improve with experience. Would highly recommend her class.

This is my first philosophy class, and I must say Professor Emmett made the philosophers easy to understand. If you want a good grade, go to the lectures, take notes, and do the readings. But for a decent grade, just go to lectures and scan the readngs when writing your paper.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Judging by some of her earlier critiques, it's clear to me that Kelin has strived to improve her lectures significantly. She breaks down the readings into easily understandable bits, and welcomes the class to share their thoughts on the philosopher's ideas as well. Classes are always interesting and engaging. Great prof and great person overall.
Dr. Emmet breaks down the text each lecture in literally sentence by sentence reading.
The tags basically say it all.  Lecture given at SFU Burnaby campus.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Participation matters']

rComments: She's a great lecturer. Makes difficult philosophical concepts easy to digest and is good at generating discussion. Always willing to offer help.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: always there to answer any questions you have, extra office hours around paper due time. she no longer has those long boring slides, no longer repeats herself, very  organized & provides great reading explanation & summary, weekly short reading assignments great to keep up with the readings. highly recommend! made me love political philosophy! :)

i took other courses with her before and she has changed a lot since. she is now more clear and organized. she also gets to the point of the topic.  highly recommend to take courses with her! i hope i see her teaching next year because i want to take more courses with her ! u don't even need wikipedia or spark notes.
Boring lectures..

No textbook for course but had online articles. She would read off the slides and just add examples here and there in class. Didn't attend lectures yet managed to get a 4.0. She is incredibly helpful when you visit office hours or ask over email. Midterm was a take-home essay and final was semi-easy. She always gives bonus questions on exam

Took this class as an elective but enjoyed it! She sometimes gets lost in lecture which leads us to not finishing what we had to cover, but her exams (short answer) are really fair. Lectures go over the case studies in the textbook, so if you take notes on both, you can get an A!

- too long powerpoint presentations (handouts) basically copy pasted from the book - no summaries and no getting to the point - not fun class - this was about food ethics so you must support vegetarianism or being vegan or you won't pass (because i suppose she is one?) - doesn't give you much time in her office hours - not helpful

Lectures are long and boring. Easy to zone out in this class. best part is no textbook so youre saving money. She keeps talking , rarely allows students to speak and cuts you off or urges to wrap it up (rude!). she's more concerned with finishing her slides . given that it is a philosophy course, there should have been more classroom discussion.

Honestly, class is so boring. She repeats herself over and over again, each time trying to make her sentences sound nicer. She seems impatient and feels like she has to finish students' sentences for them. And the readings..I don't even wanna get started on the readings. Long, tedious and boring.

Worst experience in this class! It is not a bird course and hell of a lot harder than a B-level is supposed to be. Had much more problems with the TA not being clear and helpful than the prof. Interesting material but still hated the class because of my experience with the TA/prof and their marking.

the topic was philosophy of food and it was quite interesting ... she is very nice and the class gets you thinking! i don't understand the negative reviews below cause she was extremely nice in the classes i took

Too long lecture notes and too many long readings. She could have chosen the most important readings and needs to focus and get to the point. She talks too much and repeats herself a lot, so you need to carefully read all the notes.

Definition of an average professor. Lectures, says what she needs to say and pretty much disappears. She is approachable though, but being generally philosophy courses, not much help can be given. TA's are much more helpful.
Very very interesting class! She is a super nice professor who is always willing to clarify anything! She is also extremely fair with assignments and grading. Really enjoyed the class with her!!

She is caught up in her own views and cares if you object to what she thinks is correct. Her class is very one sided and you feel that you are being forced to agree with what she says. I do not recommend any class with her unless you want to be told what to learn.

One of the worst profs I had in the past 3 years of undergrad. She does not gain the interest of her students. Didn't provide an exam review;  Which she should have considering the amount of readings in this course. Would not have taken this course had I known earlier.

Very nice + engaging Prof. Always willing to clarify concepts. If you go to lectures + do readings there is no reason not to do well. Took phlc06 with her as well. Would def. reccomend a course with her!

She's really nice and lectures pretty well. She engages the class and welcomes comments. she takes her time with the material which is great because it doesn't feel rushed. The class does run late (7-10pm) so that kind of sucks.
